headline: Russia creates security strip in Sumy after ‘breaking’ Kyiv
context: Also available in Ukrainian and Russian. More information here.

annotations.paragraph: President Trump hoped to achieve a ceasefire between Russia and Ukraine by almost reversing the Biden position in this war. That is, by being tough on Ukraine while taking a more conciliatory tone with Russia. He aspired also to achieve improved long-term relations with Moscow in America’s interests.
annotations.reason: The paragraph discusses Trump's approach to the Russia-Ukraine conflict, which is not directly related to the headline about Russia creating a security strip in Sumy.

annotations.paragraph: The US put forward a ceasefire proposal which Kyiv accepted, despite indications of serious disadvantages to itself in potential negotiations. Russia rejected it. In recent days Trump has become increasingly frustrated with Putin’s position, apparently understanding that he has been strung along.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides context on US involvement in ceasefire negotiations, but it does not directly relate to the headline about Russia's actions in Sumy.

annotations.paragraph: Now he has pulled out of a formal mediation role in the conflict. Secretary of State Marco Rubio said the US is changing “the methodology of how we contribute”, no longer playing the role of intermediary. This is a major policy change for the US and it remains to be seen exactly what role it will take up.
annotations.reason: The paragraph discusses a change in US policy regarding mediation, which is not directly related to the headline about Russia's actions in Sumy.

annotations.paragraph: Mark Rutte, the secretary-general of Nato, has proposed that members of the military alliance boost defence spending to 3.5 per cent of GDP.
annotations.reason: The paragraph discusses NATO defense spending, which is unrelated to the headline about Russia and Sumy.

annotations.paragraph: He has also suggested members commit a further 1.5 per cent to broader security-related spending to meet Donald Trump’s demand for a 5 per cent target, people familiar with the idea told Reuters.
annotations.reason: This paragraph continues the discussion on NATO spending, which is not relevant to the headline.

annotations.paragraph: Mr Rutte’s proposal could allow the US president to declare a win at a Nato summit in The Hague in June while not committing European nations and Canada to a 5 per cent pledge on military spending that many see as politically and economically unviable.
annotations.reason: The paragraph focuses on NATO summit dynamics, unrelated to the headline about Russia and Sumy.

annotations.paragraph: The alliance’s current defence spending goal is at least 2 per cent of GDP, met by 22 of its 32 members.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides information on NATO's defense spending goals, which is not relevant to the headline.

annotations.paragraph: But leaders across Nato warn that goal is no longer sufficient in the face of the threat of Russia.
annotations.reason: Although it mentions Russia, the focus is on NATO's defense spending, not directly related to the headline.
This is a timestamp and does not contribute to the article's core story.

annotations.paragraph: Ukraine has accused Russian intelligence of orchestrating an assassination attempt on a prominent Ukrainian blogger.
annotations.reason: This paragraph introduces a new fact about an alleged assassination attempt, which is relevant to the broader context of Russian-Ukrainian tensions.

annotations.paragraph: A 45-year-old woman carried out the failed hit on internet personality Serhii Sternenko, who is known in Ukraine for crowdfunding donations for military drones, Ukraine’s internal security agency, the SBU, said.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides specific details about the assassination attempt, contributing to the narrative.

annotations.paragraph: The woman had fired several shots with a pistol on Thursday, one of which hit Sternenko in the leg, it added.
annotations.reason: This paragraph adds further details about the incident, enhancing the reader's understanding.

annotations.paragraph: The blogger said there was no danger to his life.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides a direct quote from the victim, adding to the narrative.

annotations.paragraph: The United States will no longer mediate peace negotiations between Ukraine and Russia after Vladimir Putin refused to sign up to a ceasefire.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides relevant information about the US's role in peace negotiations related to the conflict.

annotations.paragraph: The State Department said it is changing “the methodology of how we contribute” to the talks and will no longer “fly around the world at the drop of a hat” for meetings.
annotations.reason: This paragraph offers additional relevant details about the US's change in approach to the negotiations.

annotations.paragraph: It comes after the US signed a minerals deal with Ukraine on more favourable terms that was originally thought. Donald Trump also reportedly signed off his administration’s first round of weapons deliveries to Kyiv.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides context about US-Ukraine relations, which is relevant to the broader geopolitical situation.

annotations.paragraph: The State Department said that Kyiv and Moscow must now present “concrete” proposals for ending the war and should meet directly to resolve the conflict.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides relevant information about diplomatic efforts related to the conflict.

annotations.paragraph: Mr Trump has been growing increasingly frustrated with Mr Putin. US intelligence briefings overnight also suggested Mr Putin is now in a weakened position and has shifted his war goals to consolidate gains.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides context on the changing dynamics of the conflict and Putin's position.

annotations.paragraph: Greek authorities have arrested a man in the strategic port city of Alexandroupolis on suspicion of photographing supply convoys on behalf of Russia, police said.
annotations.reason: This paragraph is not directly related to the main headline about Russia's actions in Sumy.

annotations.paragraph: The suspect, a 59-year-old Greek of Georgian descent, was arrested in the northeastern city on Tuesday and had a hearing on Friday.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides details about an arrest unrelated to the main headline.

annotations.paragraph: The man “confessed to taking photos and video of military material, acting on behalf of another person to whom he sent the footage via an encrypted application,” the police said.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides specific information about espionage activities related to military material, which could be relevant to the security situation in Sumy.

annotations.paragraph: A police source told AFP this week that the man, who has identified himself as a house painter, was targeting military convoys to Ukraine, according to footage retrieved from his cellphone.
annotations.reason: This paragraph adds details about the man's activities and intentions, which are relevant to the security context in Sumy.

annotations.paragraph: Two UK universities have suspended their Ukrainian societies as they investigate if they broke charity rules to buy drones that were later sent to Kyiv’s troops.
annotations.reason: This paragraph is unrelated to the security situation in Sumy and focuses on activities in the UK.

annotations.paragraph: The student unions at University College London and Lancaster University suspended the societies after they discovered the purchases, which were made last year, the Financial Times reported.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides additional details about the UK universities' actions, which are not relevant to the main story about Sumy.

annotations.paragraph: Both unions are UK-registered charities and governed by the Charity Commission.
annotations.reason: This paragraph is unrelated to the headline about Russia and Sumy.

annotations.paragraph: According to the watchdog’s rules, “providing aid or military supplies to any foreign armed force is not a charitable purpose, and no charity can legally undertake such activity”.
annotations.reason: This paragraph is unrelated to the headline about Russia and Sumy.

annotations.paragraph: Europe plans to seize and redistribute about 3 billion euros (£2.5billion) of Russia’s funds that are frozen, according to documents sources familiar with the matter.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides relevant information about actions against Russia, which is related to the broader geopolitical context of the headline.

annotations.paragraph: The money will be used to compensate Western investors after Moscow seized cash held in Russia in recent months, three people told Reuters, escalating attempts by both sides to recoup billions in funds affected by the war in Ukraine.
annotations.reason: This paragraph discusses financial compensation related to the war in Ukraine, not directly related to the security strip in Sumy.

annotations.paragraph: Euroclear will redistribute 3 billion from a pool of 10 billion euros in cash belonging to Russian entities and individuals hit by the EU sanctions following Russia’s full-scale invasion in 2022.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides information on financial sanctions, not directly related to the security strip in Sumy.

annotations.paragraph: The move marks a new level of reprisal by Europe. The EU changed its sanctions regime late last year, allowing a disbursement to Western investors.
annotations.reason: This paragraph discusses European sanctions, not directly related to the security strip in Sumy.

annotations.paragraph: US officials have prepared a set of options to increase economic pressure on Russia as Vladimir Putin refuses to agree to a ceasefire, according to people familiar with the matter.
annotations.reason: This paragraph discusses US economic pressure on Russia, not directly related to the security strip in Sumy.

annotations.paragraph: The sources, speaking to Bloomberg, cautioned that Donald Trump has not yet made a decision and diplomatic efforts are still ongoing. They did not share details on what the options are.
annotations.reason: This paragraph is unrelated to the headline about Russia and Sumy.

annotations.paragraph: Kyiv and its allies have been urging the US to step-up pressure on Moscow, including through expanding sanctions on its energy exports and oil revenues, to force Putin to the negotiation table.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides context on international pressure related to the conflict involving Russia and Ukraine.
This is a timestamp and does not contribute to the article's content.

annotations.paragraph: Ukraine’s parliament will hold a vote on May 8 to ratify a minerals deal signed with the US earlier this week, a lawmaker said on Friday.
annotations.reason: This paragraph is unrelated to the headline about Russia and Sumy.

annotations.paragraph: Washington and Kyiv signed a deal on Wednesday that will give the United States preferential access to new investments in extraction of Ukraine’s natural resources, and fund investment in Ukraine’s reconstruction.
annotations.reason: This paragraph is unrelated to the headline about Russia and Sumy.

annotations.paragraph: Lawmaker Yaroslav Zheleznyak published the date of the upcoming ratification vote on Telegram. Two of the documents related to the deal would not need to be approved by parliament.
annotations.reason: This paragraph does not relate to the headline about Russia's actions in Sumy.

annotations.paragraph: So that’s it, the US will now take a ‘hands-off’ approach to ending the war in Ukraine.
annotations.reason: This paragraph is a vague generalization and does not provide specific information related to the headline.

annotations.paragraph: Negotiators will no longer fly around the world at the “drop of a hat”, seeking to broach an agreement between the two warring parties.
annotations.reason: This paragraph is a vague generalization and does not provide specific information related to the headline.

annotations.paragraph: The signs have been there for days that Donald Trump was tiring of playing peace-maker, as the clock ticks ever further on from the 24 hours in which he had promised to end the conflict.
annotations.reason: This paragraph is unrelated to the headline about Russia and Ukraine.

annotations.paragraph: He had dedicated his best people to it for 100 days, Secretary of State Marco Rubio said last week. Other priorities would have to be attended to.
annotations.reason: This paragraph is unrelated to the headline about Russia and Ukraine.

annotations.paragraph: In truth, this amounts to an admission that Russia is not playing ball. Ukraine agreed immediately to the US’ proposal for a 30-day ceasefire. Moscow has only stalled.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides context about Russia's stance in negotiations, which is relevant to the headline.

annotations.paragraph: Also last week, Mr Trump wondered if Vladimir Putin was simply “tapping him along” in talks. Following that famous, knee-to-knee meeting with Volodymyr Zelensky in the Vatican, he has softened towards Ukraine.
annotations.reason: This paragraph is unrelated to the headline about Russia and Ukraine.

annotations.paragraph: The minerals deal is no outrageous rip-off. It recognises that Russia was behind the full-scale invasion.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides context about Russia's involvement in the invasion, which is relevant to the headline.

annotations.paragraph: In turning away from the peace process, the president leaves the Kremlin in something of a quandary. According to CNN citing intelligence sources, Putin is now focused on consolidating Russian positions on the battlefield amid a worsening economy.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides context on Russia's strategic focus and economic situation, which is relevant to the headline.

annotations.paragraph: Is Mr Trump also shifting away from his efforts to entice Russia into a grand economic relationship, something he promised if a deal could be struck? That is an overarching ambition of Putin’s - he will be eager not to let the chance slip.
annotations.reason: This paragraph speculates on Trump's actions and ambitions, which is not directly relevant to the headline.

annotations.paragraph: Will the Russian dictator engage more seriously if the US appears to be once more turning cold? Some in the White House will surely hope so.
annotations.reason: This paragraph speculates on US-Russia relations, which is not directly relevant to the headline.

annotations.paragraph: Equally, Putin could simply continue as he was before the change-over in the White House. Grinding Ukraine down, restocking his army, and waiting for the West to tire of supplying his enemy with arms.
annotations.reason: This paragraph discusses potential Russian strategies, which is relevant to the headline.

annotations.paragraph: The United States will no longer mediate peace negotiations between Ukraine and Russia, the US State Department spokesman, Tammy Bruce, told reporters.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides relevant information about the US's stance on mediating peace negotiations between Ukraine and Russia.

annotations.paragraph: Here are her full comments:
annotations.reason: This paragraph is an introduction to a quote and does not provide new information.

annotations.paragraph: “The nature of how this would change is we would not – we certainly are still committed to it and will help and do what we can. But we are not going to fly around the world at the drop of a hat to mediate meetings, that it is now between the two parties.
annotations.reason: This quote provides insight into the US's approach to the conflict, which is relevant to the topic.

annotations.paragraph: “And now – now is the time that they need to present and develop concrete ideas about how this conflict is going to end.
annotations.reason: This quote emphasizes the responsibility of the involved parties to resolve the conflict, which is relevant.

annotations.paragraph: “It’s going to be up to them.”
annotations.reason: This quote reiterates the responsibility of the parties involved, adding no new information.

annotations.paragraph: The day before the US State Department said it would no longer mediate peace negotiations between Ukraine and Russia, the Trump administration approved its first arms exports to Kyiv.
annotations.reason: Provides context on US involvement in Ukraine, but not directly related to the headline about Russia's actions in Sumy.

annotations.paragraph: Last night, the State Department said it is changing “the methodology of how we contribute” to the talks and will no longer “fly around the world at the drop of a hat” for meetings after Vladimir Putin refused to agree to a ceasefire.
annotations.reason: Discusses US diplomatic strategy, not directly related to the headline about Russia's actions in Sumy.

annotations.paragraph: Yet, the announcement came not long after it was revealed that the Trump administration informed Congress it would approve arms exports worth at least $50million to Ukraine on Wednesday.
annotations.reason: Mentions US arms exports to Ukraine, not directly related to the headline about Russia's actions in Sumy.

annotations.paragraph: The permission is the first of its kind since Mr Trump returned to office more than 100 days ago, marking a significant change in its policy, and came just weeks after Washington paused all Ukraine-related military aid for review.
annotations.reason: Provides context on US policy change, not directly related to the headline about Russia's actions in Sumy.
Timestamp without additional information.

annotations.paragraph: The war in Ukraine will not end “any time soon”, the US vice president has said.
annotations.reason: General statement about the war's duration without specific relevance to the headline.

annotations.paragraph: Speaking to Fox News, JD Vance said Donald Trump had brought Russia and Ukraine to the negotiating table but that it would now be up to them “to come to an agreement and stop this brutal, brutal conflict”.
annotations.reason: Commentary on past negotiations not directly related to the headline.

annotations.paragraph: “It’s not going anywhere… it’s not going to end any time soon,” he added.
annotations.reason: Repetition of the earlier statement about the war's duration.

annotations.paragraph: The Kremlin has expressed a willingness for direct talks with Ukraine, but this week rejected a US peace proposal because it did not grant international recognition to territory seized by its troops.
annotations.reason: Provides context on Russia's stance and actions related to territorial issues.

annotations.paragraph: Ukraine has repeatedly rejected recognising Russian annexation of its territory, saying that Vladimir Putin should not be rewarded for his aggression.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides background on Ukraine's stance on Russian annexation, which is relevant to the conflict in Sumy.

annotations.paragraph: A Russian drone attack injured 29 people in Zaporizhzhia overnight.

annotations.paragraph: A commander of a Russian airborne assault brigade told the TASS state news agency that Ukrainian troops fighting in Sumy are demoralised.

annotations.paragraph: “We have disorganised their command system,” the commander was quoted as saying.
annotations.reason: The quote provides direct commentary on the military situation in Sumy.

annotations.paragraph: Two Majors, a Russian war blogger with over 1.2 million subscribers, said Russia was developing an offensive from the villages of Zhuravka to Bilovody.
annotations.reason: This provides specific information about the Russian military strategy in the region.

annotations.paragraph: “Our paratroopers, having broken the stubborn resistance of the enemy, advanced in the area of Loknya and in the border forest belts” in the Sumy region, the blogger wrote today.
annotations.reason: The paragraph offers details on the military advancements in Sumy.

annotations.paragraph: Deep State, a Ukrainian open-source data project, indicated about 82 sq km of the Sumy region are in a contested zone.
annotations.reason: This provides context on the extent of the contested area in Sumy.

annotations.paragraph: Russia is continuing to create a “security strip” in border areas of Ukraine’s Sumy region after driving Ukrainian troops out of the Kursk region of western Russia, state news agency RIA quoted the Russian defence ministry as saying today.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides new information about Russia's actions in the Sumy region, directly related to the headline.

annotations.paragraph: It quoted the ministry as saying that in the past week, Russian troops had seized four settlements in Ukraine’s Donetsk and Kharkiv regions.
annotations.reason: This paragraph adds relevant details about Russian military actions in Ukraine, supporting the main story.

annotations.paragraph: President Vladimir Putin said in March that Russia should look to create a buffer zone in Sumy region, which borders Kursk.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides context about Russia's strategic intentions in the Sumy region, relevant to the headline.

annotations.paragraph: There were 33 clashes in the Kursk direction overnight, according to Ukrainian officials.
annotations.reason: This paragraph offers additional context about ongoing military activity in the region, relevant to the main story.

annotations.paragraph: “Our soldiers inflicted significant losses in manpower and equipment on the occupation forces, and are also actively undermining the enemy’s offensive potential in the rear.”
annotations.reason: This quote provides direct commentary on the military situation, relevant to the main story.

annotations.paragraph: “Twenty-nine people were wounded as a result of a nocturnal attack by the enemy,” on the industrial city of Zaporizhzhia, regional governor Ivan Fedorov wrote on Telegram, adding that a 13-year-old boy was amongst the victims of the drone strike.

annotations.paragraph: “The Russians have struck the city’s civilian infrastructure. Residential buildings, a university, and an infrastructure facility have been damaged,” Fedorov wrote.

annotations.paragraph: Two men were also wounded in a Russian drone attack in the eastern Dnipropetrovsk region, with fires breaking out at two locations, Governor Sergiy Lysak said on Telegram.
annotations.reason: This adds further information about the extent of Russian attacks in Ukraine, relevant to the article's theme.

annotations.paragraph: Ukraine’s national railway company said its locomotive repair plant in Zaporizhzhia was “subjected to a massive attack” overnight, which sparked a fire that raged for hours. No injuries were reported.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides information about an attack in Zaporizhzhia, which is not directly related to the headline about Russia creating a security strip in Sumy.

annotations.paragraph: The abrupt dismissal of Mike Waltz, the White House’s national security advisor, following the high-profile Signal group chat scandal, marks the first major shake-up in President Trump’s inner circle during his second term and signals uncertainty for US policy toward Ukraine.
annotations.reason: This paragraph discusses a US political event unrelated to the headline about Russia and Sumy.

annotations.paragraph: Shortly after news of Signal-gate broke, Politico reported that the president was considering dismissing Waltz, who mistakenly added a journalist to a classified group chat.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides details on a US political scandal, not related to the headline about Russia and Sumy.

annotations.paragraph: But sources close to the White House told the website that Mr Trump was desperate not to give the ‘liberal’ press a scalp. One offered a prediction: “They’ll stick by him for now, but he’ll be gone in a couple of weeks.”
annotations.reason: This paragraph contains speculation about US political dynamics, unrelated to the headline about Russia and Sumy.

annotations.paragraph: Just over a month later, Mr Waltz is gone. The dismissal will be met with a measure of anxiety in Kyiv. Mr Waltz infamously compared Ukraine to a mule that needed to be beaten over the head with a wooden plank; he spoke of Volodymyr Zelensky, the president, as a spurned girlfriend.
annotations.reason: The paragraph does not relate to the headline about Russia creating a security strip in Sumy.

annotations.paragraph: But insiders felt that those comments were designed to ensure he did not add to Mr Trump’s suspicions he was too close to Ukraine, too willing to agree to its demands and too swift to criticise Vladimir Putin.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides background on Mr Waltz's comments and their political implications, unrelated to the headline.

annotations.paragraph: For now, Mr Trump has appointed Marco Rubio as secretary of state. Mr Rubio, too, has a history of supporting Ukraine.
annotations.reason: The paragraph discusses U.S. political appointments, not directly related to the headline about Russia and Sumy.

annotations.paragraph: But there remains the chance that Mr Trump could elevate a more Maga-friendly candidate in the end, perhaps even Steve Witkoff, the peace negotiator who has come out of his series of meetings with Putin with little but an apparent appreciation for the ‘graciousness’ of the Russian dictator.
annotations.reason: This paragraph speculates on U.S. political appointments and does not relate to the headline about Russia's actions in Sumy.

annotations.paragraph: Moscow accused Kyiv of launching a drone strike on a crowded market in Russian-controlled southern Ukraine on Thursday, claiming at least seven civilians were killed and over 20 injured.

annotations.paragraph: Vladimir Saldo, the region’s Russian-installed governor, said the drones had struck a market in the town of Oleshky at around 9.30 am local time during a public holiday.
annotations.reason: This paragraph adds specific details about the location and timing of the alleged drone strike.

annotations.paragraph: He and two social media users released videos purporting to show some of the incident. Reuters confirmed the location as Oleshky, but could not independently verify when they were filmed.

annotations.paragraph: Vladyslav Voloshyn, a spokesperson for the Ukrainian military, said Kyiv had targeted Russian troops in part of Kherson region controlled by Moscow and that only military personnel, and not civilians, had been killed.

annotations.paragraph: France and Poland are set to sign a defence pact in the face of Russian aggression and amid uncertainty over the US commitment to protecting Europe.
annotations.reason: This paragraph is not directly related to the headline about Russia's actions in Sumy.

annotations.paragraph: Emmanuel Macron and Donald Tusk will sign the treaty in the French city of Nancy on May 9, the 80th anniversary of the end of World War Two, the Financial Times reported.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides details about a treaty signing unrelated to the headline.

annotations.paragraph: The French President has mooted offering Paris’ nuclear umbrella to Europe, which Mr Tusk, Poland’s Prime Minister, has signalled is a possibility he could explore. No agreement on the French bomb is expected in Nancy.
annotations.reason: This paragraph discusses potential nuclear agreements unrelated to the headline.

annotations.paragraph: “Tusk is also sending now a message to Washington, our main ally for so many years,” Aleksander Olech, a security analyst at Defence24, a Polish think-tank told the FT. “It is a clear signal that Poland is not only dependent on the US but can also have other strong nuclear allies.”
annotations.reason: This paragraph contains a quote about Poland's alliances, not directly related to the headline.

annotations.paragraph: Poland borders both Ukraine and Russia and has ramped up its defence spending since Putin’s invasion. Warsaw plans to spend 4.7 per cent of its GDP on defence this year.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides context on Poland's defense spending, not directly related to the headline.
